lines.text: You don't understand, Devlin. I mean to hire you.
Lots of people don't. I still do business with them.
I don't like your way of doing.
Well, a man can't eat the walnuts unless he cracks a few shells.
I've never been to a hanging. Mother might let you take me.
We'll be on the stage for home. Besides, you know how I feel about executions. There's some good in every man - killing him kills that, too.
[although he was declared dead after his execution, Devlin miraculously revives]
Joe, this man is legally dead!
Legally dead? That doesn't mean you're safe.
You got enemies. Bound to be some who want to test your mortality in Tres Cruces or anywhere else you go.
As your friend, I think we should go ahead and bury James Devlin.
